connector.description: Store and retrieve objects from Minio Storage Service using Minio SDK.

camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.name: camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateBucket
camel.sink.endpoint.autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket if bucket name not exist.

camel.sink.endpoint.customHttpClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.customHttpClient
camel.sink.endpoint.customHttpClient.description: Set custom HTTP client for authenticated access.

camel.sink.endpoint.endpoint.name: camel.sink.endpoint.endpoint
camel.sink.endpoint.endpoint.description: Endpoint can be an URL, domain name, IPv4 address or IPv6 address.

camel.sink.endpoint.minioClient.name: camel.sink.endpoint.minioClient
camel.sink.endpoint.minioClient.description: Reference to a Minio Client object in the registry.

camel.sink.endpoint.policy.name: camel.sink.endpoint.policy
camel.sink.endpoint.policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the method.

camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.name: camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort
camel.sink.endpoint.proxyPort.description: TCP/IP port number. 80 and 443 are used as defaults for HTTP and HTTPS.

camel.sink.endpoint.region.name: camel.sink.endpoint.region
camel.sink.endpoint.region.description: The region in which Minio client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1). You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.sink.endpoint.secure.name: camel.sink.endpoint.secure
camel.sink.endpoint.secure.description: Flag to indicate to use secure connection to minio service or not.

camel.sink.endpoint.serverSideEncryption.name: camel.sink.endpoint.serverSideEncryptionCustomerKey
camel.sink.endpoint.serverSideEncryption.description: Server-side encryption for source object while copy/move objects.

camel.sink.endpoint.deleteAfterWrite.name: camel.sink.endpoint.deleteAfterWrite
camel.sink.endpoint.deleteAfterWrite.description: Delete file object after the Minio file has been uploaded.

camel.sink.endpoint.keyName.name: camel.sink.endpoint.keyName
camel.sink.endpoint.keyName.description: Setting the key name for an element in the bucket through endpoint parameter.

camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer
camel.sink.endpoint.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.sink.endpoint.operation.name: camel.sink.endpoint.operation
camel.sink.endpoint.operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to do only an upload. One of: [copyObject] [listObjects] [deleteObject] [deleteObjects] [deleteBucket] [listBuckets] [getObject] [getObjectRange]

camel.sink.endpoint.pojoRequest.name: camel.sink.endpoint.pojoRequest
camel.sink.endpoint.pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not.

camel.sink.endpoint.storageClass.name: camel.sink.endpoint.storageClass
camel.sink.endpoint.storageClass.description: The storage class to set in the request.

camel.sink.endpoint.accessKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.accessKey
camel.sink.endpoint.accessKey.description: Amazon AWS Secret Access Key or Minio Access Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.

camel.sink.endpoint.secretKey.name: camel.sink.endpoint.secretKey
camel.sink.endpoint.secretKey.description: Amazon AWS Access Key Id or Minio Secret Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.

camel.component.minio.autoCreateBucket.name: camel.component.minio.autoCreateBucket
camel.component.minio.autoCreateBucket.description: Setting the autocreation of the bucket if bucket name not exist.

camel.component.minio.customHttpClient.name: camel.component.minio.customHttpClient
camel.component.minio.customHttpClient.description: Set custom HTTP client for authenticated access.

camel.component.minio.endpoint.name: camel.component.minio.endpoint
camel.component.minio.endpoint.description: Endpoint can be an URL, domain name, IPv4 address or IPv6 address.

camel.component.minio.minioClient.name: camel.component.minio.minioClient
camel.component.minio.minioClient.description: Reference to a Minio Client object in the registry.

camel.component.minio.policy.name: camel.component.minio.policy
camel.component.minio.policy.description: The policy for this queue to set in the method.

camel.component.minio.proxyPort.name: camel.component.minio.proxyPort
camel.component.minio.proxyPort.description: TCP/IP port number. 80 and 443 are used as defaults for HTTP and HTTPS.

camel.component.minio.region.name: camel.component.minio.region
camel.component.minio.region.description: The region in which Minio client needs to work. When using this parameter, the configuration will expect the lowercase name of the region (for example ap-east-1). You'll need to use the name Region.EU_WEST_1.id()

camel.component.minio.secure.name: camel.component.minio.secure
camel.component.minio.secure.description: Flag to indicate to use secure connection to minio service or not.

camel.component.minio.serverSideEncrypti.name: camel.component.minio.serverSideEncryptionCustomerKey
camel.component.minio.serverSideEncrypti.description: Server-side encryption for source object while copy/move objects.

camel.component.minio.deleteAfterWrite.name: camel.component.minio.deleteAfterWrite
camel.component.minio.deleteAfterWrite.description: Delete file object after the Minio file has been uploaded.

camel.component.minio.keyName.name: camel.component.minio.keyName
camel.component.minio.keyName.description: Setting the key name for an element in the bucket through endpoint parameter.

camel.component.minio.lazyStartProducer.name: camel.component.minio.lazyStartProducer
camel.component.minio.lazyStartProducer.description: Whether the producer should be started lazy (on the first message). By starting lazy you can use this to allow CamelContext and routes to startup in situations where a producer may otherwise fail during starting and cause the route to fail being started. By deferring this startup to be lazy then the startup failure can be handled during routing messages via Camel's routing error handlers. Beware that when the first message is processed then creating and starting the producer may take a little time and prolong the total processing time of the processing.

camel.component.minio.operation.name: camel.component.minio.operation
camel.component.minio.operation.description: The operation to do in case the user don't want to do only an upload. One of: [copyObject] [listObjects] [deleteObject] [deleteObjects] [deleteBucket] [listBuckets] [getObject] [getObjectRange]

camel.component.minio.pojoRequest.name: camel.component.minio.pojoRequest
camel.component.minio.pojoRequest.description: If we want to use a POJO request as body or not.

camel.component.minio.storageClass.name: camel.component.minio.storageClass
camel.component.minio.storageClass.description: The storage class to set in the request.

camel.component.minio.autowiredEnabled.name: camel.component.minio.autowiredEnabled
camel.component.minio.autowiredEnabled.description: Whether autowiring is enabled. This is used for automatic autowiring options (the option must be marked as autowired) by looking up in the registry to find if there is a single instance of matching type, which then gets configured on the component. This can be used for automatic configuring JDBC data sources, JMS connection factories, AWS Clients, etc.

camel.component.minio.accessKey.name: camel.component.minio.accessKey
camel.component.minio.accessKey.description: Amazon AWS Secret Access Key or Minio Access Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.

camel.component.minio.secretKey.name: camel.component.minio.secretKey
camel.component.minio.secretKey.description: Amazon AWS Access Key Id or Minio Secret Key. If not set camel will connect to service for anonymous access.
